history.content:
Emailing professors probably won't be very effective, they get tons of similar inquiries. Some techniques that might work:

  • Applying to posted opportunities on beehive or through URAP.
  • Find a professor doing work you are interested in, become familiar with their research, and visit them in office hours. Bring a resume and transcript.
  • Graduate students are more likely to respond to cold-emails than a professor. Find a lab that you are interested in and reach out to a few grad students.

children.subject: Don't restrict yourself to the CS department either. Many other departments in Berkeley are looking for people with CS skills! I'm in Civil Engineering and a lot of disciplines in Civil Engineering are embracing deep learning/machine learning (if that's your thing). Even if you're not into machine learning, doing work for other departments can also just help build up your research skills and resume.

history.content:
How do I get involved in research? Do I have start emailing professors. I don't have any prior research experience .

                                                                Thank you!!
history.subject: CS Research
